Design Pattern - Strategy (Policy)

Created:2018-03-07  Last modified:2018-03-07

  • Introduction
  • Examples

  1. Introduction

    Provided an interface for different algorithm that achieves the same goal.

    Examples

    1. e.g. sorting
    2. e.g. motion behavior in the robot.

    Terms

    • Strategy: declares an interface common to all supported algorithm e.g. Sorting {sort(int [] array);}
    • ConcreteStrategy: implements the interface with a specific algorithm.
    • Context: ...

  2. Examples

    Strategy pattern allows to define a family of algorithms. For example, the Java Map classes.

    The java.util.Map is an interface, which defines get, set, containsKey, clear methods.

    All concrete classes, such as HashMap, TreeMap, would implement this interface.

    To use this method, user only needs to declare Map<string,string> container = new HashMap<>();
